intro: Smilax, commonly known as greenbriar, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Smilacaceae. These plants are characterized by their woody stems, which can be thorny or spiny, and their climbing or trailing growth habit. They produce small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, followed by bright red or orange berries. Smilax species are found in various habitats, including forests, wetlands, and disturbed areas, and they are often used in traditional medicine. Their ability to thrive in diverse environments makes them an important part of many ecosystems.
